hook.text: France now bans destroying unsold clothing. Brands must donate or recycle every leftover garment.

buildup.text: For decades, luxury brands burned unsold stock to protect exclusivity. Burberry torched $37 million worth.

discovery.text: The EU now requires durability labels and digital product passports so buyers know what they're getting.

twist.text: Critics warn that without enforcement, these laws become greenwashing toolsâ€”compliance on paper only.

climax.text: Legislation alone won't fix fashion, but it shifts sustainability costs from consumers to corporations.

punchline.text: Laws can't fix fashion, but they can force brands to try.

quiz.question: What did France's legislation require fashion brands to do with unsold clothing?
options: Export it to developing countries for resale at discounted rates
Store it in government warehouses for up to five years
Donate or recycle it instead of destroying it
